choices.text:
explain use of Large Language Models (LLM) in AI research
Large language models, or LLMs for short are a type of artificial intelligence model that can read and write. They’re trained on large amounts of text data to learn how words relate to one another within sentences. These models have been shown to be able to generate new text with similar meaning as the training set they were taught from (known as “transfer learning"). LLMs are a type of deep neural network, which is an artificial intelligence model that can read and write.
